org.schwering.evi.core
Class ModuleLoader

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.ClassLoader
      java.security.SecureClassLoader
          java.net.URLClassLoader
              org.schwering.evi.core.ModuleLoader
public final class ModuleLoader
extends java.net.URLClassLoader

Provides methods to load JARs.

For a module developer, most of these methods are probably unimportant. However, he might be interesting in the following:

  • The following three methods can be used to search for loaded modules:
    • getLoadedIds()
    • getLoadedModules()
    • getLoadedModule(String)
  • The following methods can be used to check whether a module is loaded:
    • isLoaded(ModuleContainer)
    • isLoaded(String)

Version:
$Id: ModuleLoader.java 48 2006-05-11 00:10:51Z schwering $
Author:
Christoph Schwering (mailto:schwering@gmail.com)

Field Detail

ATTR_MODULE_CLASS

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_CLASS
The module's main class (which is also the id) attribute in the manifest.
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Module-Class".
An example for a module-class in a manifest-file is:
Module-Class: bla.package.comes.here.MyModule

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ATTR_MODULE_VERSION

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_VERSION
The module's version attribute in the manifest. It is optional to define a module version.
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Module-Version".
An example for a module-version-attribute in a manifest-file is:
Module-Version: 1.0

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ATTR_MODULE_NAME

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_NAME
The module's name attribute in the manifest. It is optional to define a module name. If no name is set, the id is also used as name.
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Module-Version".
An example for a module-version-attribute in a manifest-file is:
Module-Version: 1.0

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ATTR_MODULE_CONFIG_CLASS

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_CONFIG_CLASS
The module's config classname if the module is configurable with a GUI. Providing a configuration GUI for a module is optionally; just leave this attribute out if your module doesn't have a configuration panel.
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Module-Config-Class".
An example for a module-protocol-attribute in a manifest-file is:
"Module-Config-Class: my.package.module.ConfigPanel".

See Also:
ModuleConfigFactory, Constant Field Values

ATTR_MODULE_PROTOCOLS

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_PROTOCOLS
The module's protocols attribute in the manifest. It is optional to define protocols. For example, a browser module should register "http".
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Module-Protocols".
An example for a module-protocol-attribute in a manifest-file is:
"Module-Protocols: http https irc".

See Also:
org.schwering.evi.gui.EVI#startArgRelatedModules(String[]), Constant Field Values

ATTR_MODULE_REQUIREMENTS

public static final java.lang.String ATTR_MODULE_REQUIREMENTS
The module's requirements attribute in the manifest. It is optional to define requirements.
This field is public because you should know about this attribute.
This field's value is: "Requirements".
An example for a module-requirement-attribute in a manifest-file is:
"Requires: foo.bar.BlaModule foo.bar.BlupModule:1.0 foo.bar.BumModule foo.bar.PiffModule foo.bar.PaffModule:2.1".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

load

public static ModuleContainer load(java.io.File f)
                            throws ModuleLoaderException
Loads a new module. Fires the IModuleLoaderListener.loaded(ModuleContainer) event.

Parameters:
f - The destination of the JAR.
Returns:
A ModuleContainer for the module.
Throws:
ModuleLoaderException - If anything fails.

load

public static ModuleContainer load(java.net.URL url)
                            throws ModuleLoaderException
Loads a new module. Fires the IModuleLoaderListener.loaded(ModuleContainer) event.

Parameters:
url - The destination of the JAR.
Returns:
A ModuleContainer for the module.
Throws:
ModuleLoaderException - If anything fails.

load

public static ModuleContainer load(java.lang.String moduleClassName)
                            throws ModuleLoaderException
Loads a one-class-module. The version is simply 0.0 and there are no requirements. The method also fires the IModuleLoaderListener.loaded(ModuleContainer) event.

Parameters:
moduleClassName - The classname: my.package.Class
Returns:
A ModuleContainer for the module.
Throws:
ModuleLoaderException - If anything fails.

unload

public static void unload(java.lang.String id)
Unloads a module. Each instance of module is shut down softly via ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(). After that, the IModuleLoaderListener.unloaded(ModuleContainer) event is fired.

Parameters:
id - The id of the module that is intended to be unloaded.

getLoadedIds

public static java.lang.String[] getLoadedIds()
Returns an array of the loaded modules' ids.

Returns:
An array containing the ids of all loaded modules.

getLoadedModules

public static ModuleContainer[] getLoadedModules()
Returns an array of the loaded modules.

Returns:
An array containing all loaded modules.

getLoadedModule

public static ModuleContainer getLoadedModule(java.lang.String moduleId)
Looks for a loaded module.

Parameters:
moduleId - The id of the module that is requested.
Returns:
A loaded module.

isLoaded

public static boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String id)
Indicates whether a module is loaded or not.

Parameters:
id - The id of the module that might have been loaded.
Returns:
true if the module is loaded.

isLoaded

public static boolean isLoaded(ModuleContainer module)
Indicates whether a module is loaded or not.

Parameters:
module - The container of the module that might have been loaded.
Returns:
true if the module is loaded.
